[[Kevin Lee Poulsen]] | music = | cinematography = Dan Park | editing = Sam Bozzo | distributor = [[Trigger Street Productions]] | released = not officially released, but leaked | runtime = 87 min | language = [[English language|English]] | budget = }} '''''Hackers Wanted''''' is an unreleased [[United States|American]] [[documentary film]]. Directed and written by [[Sam Bozzo]], the film explores the origins and nature of hackers and [[hacker (computer security)|hacking]] by following the adventures of [[Adrian Lamo]], and contrasting his story with that of controversial figures throughout history. The film is narrated by [[Kevin Spacey]]. Originally named "Can You Hack It?" {{cite web | title = Can You Hack It? (2007) | publisher = [[Internet Movie Database]] | date = May 20, 2007 | url = http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0816690/ | archivedate = October 18, 2007 | archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20071018064053/http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0816690/ | accessdate = May 20, 2010}} The film failed to get a conventional release, according to Lamo, because of conflicts between its producer and others on the team. The more commonly cited reason is a problem with the quality of the finished product. On May 20, 2010, a version of the film was leaked to [[BitTorrent (protocol)|BitTorrent]]. Lamo has stated that he had no involvement in the leak. {{cite web | last = enigmax | title = Unreleased âHackers Wantedâ Movie Leaks To BitTorrent | publisher = [[TorrentFreak]] | date = May 20, 2010 | url = http://torrentfreak.com/unreleased-hackers-wanted-movie-leaks-to-bittorrent-100520/ | accessdate = May 20, 2010}}
